metadata.title: CVE-2015-8944 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The ioresources_init function in kernel/resource.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.7, as used in Android before 2016-08-05 on Nexus 6 and 7 (2013)devices, uses weak permissions for /proc/iomem, which allows local users toobtain sensitive information by reading this file, aka Android internal bug28814213 and Qualcomm internal bug CR786116. NOTE: the permissions may beintentional in most non-Android contexts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-125-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-lowlatency - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-3.13.0-125-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-125.174
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-125-generic - 3.13.0-125.174
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-lowlatency - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-87-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-87-generic - 4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-125.174').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-87.110~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
